values:
I've been playing the games on stupid  pop up banners. Stomp the clown. Swat the fly. Hit the roach with a rolled up magazine. Over the past thirty minutes  I have  won half a dozen iPods and a few trips to Hollywood in a round of Tyler Durden-esque violence.

I am Jack's inflamed sense of rejection.

And now, I will go off in search of larger things, like breakfast.
http://thingsoflove.livejournal.com/4275.html

Through leaps and bounds of vertical sounds our stories write themselves... 



I've been taking steps.. I've been believing what I've been telling myself little by little.. 

I've been collecting lack of sleep and talking with my insomniac bunny, Pickles. 

I've become the epitome of conflusion.  



Pickles, also known as Avenged Viking Princess, is staring at me. I think she's on my side but it's hard to tell between the bars of her cage. Pickles has feet black from news print - she demands a fresh supply of the New York Times each and every week. I lay it out in rectangular form for her to devour and peruse the wanted ads. She rips it up, as any good consumer does, upon finishing the paper, and watches me walk by, expecting something from me.  



My plan is going slowly, and it's getting tiresome, and apart from a slight bite of fright that I'll let myself slide and wake up somewhere in the future without accomplishing anything that I started out wanting, I am trying to stay awake when it comes to the long term. I will be graduating some time mid-summer next year, and in the following fall I'd like to find myself in New York, going to school. I seek to leave behind everything I know and accept everything I have no knowledge of into my bubble. I want a bubble-widening experience. As silly as it sounds, I find myself wondering what the other side of the Mason-Dixon looks like. And I have yet to meet a person in my life who actually thinks that is going to happen. I haven't decided if that is including myself or not. 



The best laid plans are yet to be made.
http://thingsoflove.livejournal.com/3940.html

Tomorrow had better be a whole lot better than today... or.. I'm... gonna... I'll.. just.. 
.... 
Goodnight.
http://thingsoflove.livejournal.com/3758.html
http://thingsoflove.livejournal.com/3393.html

What I find more fascinating than the fact that Steve Irwin played with crocs for a few dozen years and was downed by a stingray is how many people are talking about Steve Irwin.
Everyone is talking about Steve Irwin. 
It's gone past the "G'Day!" and "Crikey!" comments of old.
It's now, "I love that guy, he was great" and various other I remember when's.
I never really watched his show. I can't tell you that I'm a huge fan of a) Australia b) crocodiles c) hunters or d) Australian Crocodile Hunters. But I can say that I am a huge fan of anyone that lives life that way. He did what he loved and was not afraid to take chances, no matter what the stakes.
http://thingsoflove.livejournal.com/3116.html

Let's go through this, like a piano breakdown...
Yesterday I wandered around inside my own head by way of trying to deal with people. 
I've begun to notice how old cliche's became old cliches. A lot of them are true. Makes me want to remember what I learned in kindergarten, all those dumb phrases that were supposed to guide through life that we, inevitably, decided were dumb phrases somewhere around fifth grade.
I sponsored a child yesterday from the CCF. He is two years old, from Zambia, whose name I can't pronounce. So, accordingly, I had dreams last night of babies, wrapped in shrinkwrap up to the shoulders and paraded around in front of me. If I could afford more than thirty dollars a month, heaven knows... 
When I am older I will adopt kids like there is no tomorrow.

I'm throwing a party for my friend here tomorrow. I am buying alcohol illegally and concocting desserts. My buddy offered to bring some moonshine. I wanted to pop him over the head, pack my suitcase and leave.
Which is not a usual reaction, so I'm forced to wonder and pursue this need for leaving town.

Hmm.

Work to be done.
http://thingsoflove.livejournal.com/2887.html
http://thingsoflove.livejournal.com/2808.html

It's at it again!
My ipod is determined to ruin my foul mood. 
a tap-a, tap-tap-tap-a
One by one my songs float by
Death Cab breaks me down, line by line and leaves me Barenaked
Jem bakes me a Cake, sweetened with Subliminal Nirvana
Schleprok kicks me in the Shins while Counting Crows
Until I am left Weezing
The world Everclear
http://thingsoflove.livejournal.com/2558.html

I was rummaging through notebooks from last semester. In between recycled pages, somewhere amidst notes on the Punic Wars and water pollution was written in the sidelines : I did great today.

Hijinx ensues.
http://thingsoflove.livejournal.com/2246.html
http://thingsoflove.livejournal.com/1975.html

If heaven and hell decide that they both are satisfied
Illuminate the no's on their vacancy sign
If there's no one beside you when your soul embarks
I will follow you into the dark


It's kind of amazing how songs can follow you throughout an entire day
I'm pretty sure Ben Gibbard's voice has been floating behind me 
Had I pressed my heels into my eyes and looked behind me at just the right moment, I would have seen the music
http://thingsoflove.livejournal.com/1720.html

HM. So.
An update. 
I put some pictures in of a pillow fight between me and my brother..

And.. I'm currently intertwined in a love triangle between me, my best friend's boss, and his GIRLFRIEND, whom he hates but apparently can't leave...

Fun in the sun.
http://thingsoflove.livejournal.com/1530.html

I really don't know if it's still kosher to talk frankly and honestly about what's going on in your life, but... because you all are my friends.. 
Let me just say...

It's been _____ so many months since my last ee er and Keith at the Hardware Store is hot.. So.. 

Casual sex is still okay, right?
http://thingsoflove.livejournal.com/869.html

Listening to Weezer, again...

I want to go to school in Dublin. It would be easier, over there, to go through the AU, but that would mean I would have to apply to the AU first, and.. blah blah blah..

By just going to University College Dublin as an International Student, I could cut out the American University step and just have to deal with ten thousand other things, like apartments, jobs, visas, books, etc...

Anyway. The School of English and Drama is looking pretty good, 'sallI'msayin...
http://thingsoflove.livejournal.com/685.html

Shh... 
We're only interested in guerilla style blogging. Oh, and two-to-three years of corporate experience.

Am I the only one finding it hard to settle down? Take my combined talents, interests, etc, and you've got nothing without a bachelor's degree behind it.

Give me money, Give me money
Without string attachments and degrees...

It comes down to how lazy you can get away with being at twenty years old. 

We're a full letter away in the generation game from those that a running the world, but what does X have to compare to the other's standards, aside from parental manipulation and side-shots taken of ourselves with out hair in our face?

Grammar: Run on sentence.
http://thingsoflove.livejournal.com/310.html
